scripts.start: [[ $STARTUP_SH ]] && source $STARTUP_SH keys; npm start --prefix server & npm start --prefix ui
scripts.test: [[ $STARTUP_SH ]] && source $STARTUP_SH keys; npm test --prefix server && npm run test-coverage --prefix ui
scripts.test-e2e: [[ $STARTUP_SH ]] && source $STARTUP_SH keys; npm start --prefix server & npm run test-e2e --prefix ui
scripts.deploy: npm run build && firebase deploy && npm run deploy --prefix server
scripts.outdated-all: (echo CLI: && npm outdated || true) && (echo UI: && npm outdated --prefix ui || true) && (echo SERVER: && npm outdated --prefix server || true)
scripts.install-all-comment: echo We use npm ci here, which is same as npm install but more strict. Read more about it here: https://docs.npmjs.com/cli/v6/commands/npm-ci#description
scripts.install-all: npm run delete-all && npm ci && npm ci --prefix ui && npm ci --prefix server
scripts.update-package-json-all: npm install npm-check-updates --no-save && ncu -u && pushd ui && ncu -u && popd && pushd server && ncu -u && popd
scripts.update-all: npm run update-package-json-all && npm run delete-all && rm package-lock.json ui/package-lock.json server/package-lock.json && npm install && npm install --prefix ui && npm install --prefix server && npm run force-https && npm run outdated-all
